website_summaries.verdict: It protects plants you don't want to kill, but you have to tolerate the price, odor, and slow results.
pros: Stands out for its superior ability to target unwanted grass without harming flowering plants
cons: Pricey, and it takes a while to work - up to several weeks
Some extremely tough weeds may not be affected

customer_reviews.title: Bye bye Bermuda grass!!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is great. Last year I moved into a house that had landscape beds filled with Bermuda grass. I hate Bermuda grass. Trying to dig it out of hard dried soil will kill you, not the grass. First application killed about 70% of it. Second application killed about 95%. There are a few strands here and there, but the landscape beds look beautiful and neat. I'm no longer embarrassed about the appearance of my landscaping and now I have one of the prettiest houses on the block.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This Works Quite Well
customer_reviews.text: I hybridize daylilies and they have become infested with Quackgrass. It does not harm the plants but it is infested all over the garden. It was suggested to try this product. It works quite well. 1. Use product with a good surfactant. 2. Apply early in season as the Quackgrass is starting to grow 3. Apply repeatedly and it does not harm the daylilies 4. In a week it kills off the Quackgrass that has infested the flowers 5. After the growing season it does not really work so remember to start early and often 6. I have not examined multi season protection but will do so later. Overall it is great!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Terrence McGartyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend getting this if you have Burmuda grass that you ...
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend getting this if you have Burmuda grass that you want to get rid of. It killed off the Burmuda without killing off the fescue. I had a small patch of Burmuda that I would keep pulling out but it was a losing battle. The patch got bigger and bigger. So I used the Ornament 170 and this is what happened. (See picture). Now I just have to throw out some grass seed and hopefully next summer I'll have nothing but fescue.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: the second one is stronger and works better. Also
customer_reviews.text: This is the 1.7% concentration , and has NO surfactant . ( need to buy surfactant separately ) . There is another Ornamec which is 6.75% concentration ( and comes with a small bottle of surfactant ) . Clearly , the second one is stronger and works better . Also , less product is needed to cover the yard . Always zoom the LABEL an check the Percentage concentration . Other than that , it really works to kill Bermuda grass , which is otherwise impossible to get rid of ( as it spreads through ryzomes ) , and chokes all other plants and grasses around it . Happy Spraying !!! :)
customer_reviews.author: Zbigniew Ras

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works great!!!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is awesome!! It killed out the burmuda grass but didn't harm my fescue, bluegrass or shrubs. Most of my neighbor's yard is burmuda and it was slowly taking over my yard including the new sod I put down a month earlier when I used roundup to kill out a section of burmuda. I sprayed this over my yard and it killed out all of the burmuda!! My neighbor even bought a bottle to try it out. Much like weeds I will have to spray it down once or twice a year but that is better than letting it take over my yard!
customer_reviews.author: J. Calia

customer_reviews.title: It works but may require several applications
customer_reviews.text: I use this to kill Bermuda grass in my gardens. It does kill the grass without affecting Juniper, or other perennials in the garden but it takes a while to act and usually takes a couple of applications to be effective so even though the grass dies it is still there but brown instead of green. Eventually it will decay enough to fall and disappear. So, a mixed result. By keeping on top of the new shoots I have reduced the occurrence of the grass in the garden since this produce seems to kill the root also preventing new runners..
customer_reviews.author: H Davis

customer_reviews.title: Use at recommended ratios, then wait 21-30 days
customer_reviews.text: This stuff will eliminate Bermuda grass growing in Zoyzia, but you have to be patient. Use at recommended ratios, then wait 30 days. It DOES work, but very slowly. It will weaken your Zoyzia, but won't' kill it, unless you become impatient and over-spray or use a too strong mixture. Mix as recommended. I got too aggressive and did some severe damage to my lawn. As the label says, it may take two growing seasons to eliminate the Bermuda. Don't forget pre-emergent control.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Blake

customer_reviews.title: If you use this according to instructions.. wow ...
customer_reviews.text: If you use this according to instructions.. wow. I thought it wasn't working for a bit and then I realized every blade of grass had turned straw colored. It takes time and perhaps even multiple applications, but since it's concentrated... well it's a bargain compared to other premixed solutions.
customer_reviews.author: wunderschonen

customer_reviews.title: It really works!
customer_reviews.text: Applied to my fescue lawn to kill bermudagrass, and it worked with just 2 applications. May need to reapply next year, but it really killed the bermuda. First solution I've found that works for this problem!
customer_reviews.author: jc

customer_reviews.title: Had no idea how well this would actually work. ...
customer_reviews.text: Had no idea how well this would actually work. I live in the south and used it very early Spring and it wiped out every bit of bermuda it touched. Be prepared for some serious dead spots as it took no time to kill the unwanted grass. After killing the bermuda I dethatched, raked and planted new fescue seed that has slowly started coming back. Works as advertised if used correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: We have a real problem with "wire grass" in South ...
customer_reviews.text: We have a real problem with "wire grass" in South Carolina. This seemed to work fairly well but not as well as what others experienced. Maybe I should have ordered the "Over the Top" bottle. I used it several times and still have not gotten rid of the Wire Grass Bermuda. It is going dormant now since it is November so I will have to tackle it again in the spring. I may try the Over the Top type then.
customer_reviews.author: DJ SQUARED

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Wow. This is fantastic. I used it to get rid of the Bermuda grass in my Zoysia. Works fantastic. Well worth every penny spent. You only need a little bit.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda S

customer_reviews.title: Only Thing that Works on Bermuda Grass
customer_reviews.text: Only thing that kills Bermuda grass to the root. It takes a while - about 3-4 weeks for it to start turning brown but so far this is the only product that I have found that will kill common Bermuda in flower bed without harming the flowers & shrubs. Other reviews indicate that we can add a wetting agent to the Ornamec. We are thinking about trying it and see if it will kill the Bermuda faster. It takes a long time and had to apply it 3-4 times but it does what it says.
customer_reviews.author: Sadie 789

customer_reviews.title: Safe for all plants because it didn't kill anything
customer_reviews.text: Well, "safe for all plants" might be a stretch. I applied the product four times and got only slight yellowing of the grasses it's supposed to kill. I ended up pulling out the grass by hand and then applying Roundup with a small brush on everything else that popped up.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Schonecker

customer_reviews.title: Kills grass not plants
customer_reviews.text: This product works. We have terrible torpedo grass that likes to grow in the flower beds. This kills the grass without killing the plants. It does not work for weeds unfortunately. It takes about 2 weeks for the grass to yellow and die. I wish it came pre mixed.
customer_reviews.author: work in progress

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product!  It does not kill grass!
customer_reviews.text: This product did not kill any grass. And when it didn’t kill it when mixed at the recommended rate I added more, it still didn’t kill any grass.
customer_reviews.author: Rosenlap

customer_reviews.title: Used on bermuda grass
customer_reviews.text: Bermuda grass is next to impossible to eradicate. This helps the battle better than any other product we have used, not perfect, but helped us gain an advantage on it! We have a fescue lawn. You must reapply according to the directions. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Janna4

customer_reviews.title: It’s working but it takes a long time.
customer_reviews.text: The label says it may take 3 weeks to work and it does. Be patient. I used it on area with wildflowers and they seemed to get a little leaf burn but it looks like they are ok. It’s not cheap but I paid half the price of the only retail seller in my area.
customer_reviews.author: M. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Still testing
customer_reviews.text: I have lots of grass growing in my shrubs. Alot of work to pick each piece out. I have used this twice in one area. Want to test to be sure it doesn't kill the shrub. So far it looks like the grass is turning brown so I think it is working.
customer_reviews.author: carolyn

customer_reviews.title: The process takes a long time to see full results
customer_reviews.text: I am using this product to remove Bermuda weedy grass from Fescue lawn. So far, so good. Process is clearly explained, works as described so far, requires multiple treatments over months. Outcome not clear, but positive results so far.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: I think the Ornamec is a great product it worked on the Bermuda grass and it ...
customer_reviews.text: I think the Ornamec is a great product it worked on the Bermuda grass and it did not kill the st. Augustine that was underneath of it... It works equally as well on numerous other seasonal weeds the Cloverleaf the dollar etcetera
customer_reviews.author: Rick Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Save Your Wildflowers
customer_reviews.text: This herbicide has saved my Texas Bluebonnets from invasive Rye grass by allowing me to kill the grass without killing my wildflowers. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: M. Boone

customer_reviews.title: Used it in my wildflower garden and crossed my fingers ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it in my wildflower garden and crossed my fingers that it wouldn't kill the flowers. It worked! It does take 10 - 14 days for the grass to fully die and the stuff isn't cheap; thus my 4 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: OsterCharm

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Killed the grass but did not harm the plants the grass was growing around. It was easy to use and I'm very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Purchased to kill Bermuda and Crab Grass
customer_reviews.text: It arrived in just a few days and the Instructions were easy to read and understand. I read all the reviews before deciding to order it. I applied it a week ago using a 4 gallon pack sprayer and it appears to be killing the Bermuda and Crab Grass as I wanted. I should know in about another week if it is really going to work like it is suppose to. I pray it does!
customer_reviews.author: Wilbert Smith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bermuda grass control even in zoysia.
customer_reviews.text: So far having great luck removing common bermuda/wiregrass from both fescue and zeon zoysia. This is the best stuff I have purchased for bermuda problems. Gave some to my neighbor and he said the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Virginiafamily

customer_reviews.title: Even better than advertised
customer_reviews.text: An outstanding product works on killing Bermuda grass even better than advertised. It is easy to use and begins to show results, as the Bermuda grass turns brown within the first two days.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: Kills bermuda grass.
customer_reviews.text: Sprayed over a fescue and bermuda grass mix. Killed all of the bermuda but left the fescue alone. Applied in late September in Maryland. Hardest part is getting the bermuda up after it is killed, although it is easier to pull when dead then when green.
customer_reviews.author: chuck

customer_reviews.title: Die grass! Die!
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says. Spray on grass choked flower beds, grass dies, flowers thrive. My black eyed Susan’s never looked so good. Expensive but effective.
customer_reviews.author: K. Trsek

customer_reviews.title: Works great I applied it twice at the end of summer ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great I applied it twice at the end of summer using a hose end sprayer and it killed all my Bermuda but didn’t harm my fescue
customer_reviews.author: Mastercraft

customer_reviews.title: didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: it relay didn't work it actually liked my grass but not the weed
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Product works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: After about one week of use I could see discoloration of bermuda grass within fescue grass. I believe that within about 3 seasons of treatment that the bermuda grass will be gone... but I know that bermuda grass is tough... I have lived in the South my entire life and was raised that bermuda grass was desirable. I now live in a transitional zone where Bermuda grass is undesirable.
customer_reviews.author: charles trotter

customer_reviews.title: Test first! Killed my normal grass.
customer_reviews.text: Killed my normal grass and did nothing to bermuda grass. Good thing I tried small area
customer_reviews.author: Kim Vongsavath

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful grass killer.
customer_reviews.text: Yep, it kills the grass but not the wildflowers. We use a LOT of this - spendy but an easy way to knock out wildgrass that can take over the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Mckamey

customer_reviews.title: Great product to kill Bermuda where you want Fescue
customer_reviews.text: This product works very well. It will take multiple applications, but this bottle will last many applications. Great investment if you are trying to grow Fescue in an area that gets invaded by Bermuda.
customer_reviews.author: Davidson, NC

customer_reviews.title: Messes up Bermuda grass!
customer_reviews.text: Have used this twice on the yard before reseeding, worked great! Now I want to see how well we do next summer keeping the Bermuda away.
customer_reviews.author: Dave A

customer_reviews.title: purdy darn good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Only stuff I've found that kills the ample Bermuda grass (BG)I have. I used it on BG growing in dirt as I've killed off the lawn to start over, put it down first part of June and it's zapped all the life out of it, very brittle, breaks up with gentle raking.
customer_reviews.author: smile

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: It was applied according to the instructions. Didn't kill anything, applied again and no result. Applied the third time and still no change in weeds. Very disappointing, since item can't be return or refunded.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: No results
customer_reviews.text: Did not work for me Bermuda is still alive and i have applied this product twice
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Hine

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying for 30 years to get rid of wire grass. Finally found something that works.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Bermuda Grass Killer that works!
customer_reviews.text: I have had 'out of control' Bermuda Grass for years, tried many different products to kill off the grass with no luck, but Ornamec 170 did the job. If used as directed and take the time with multiple applications, this product works.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Monroe

customer_reviews.title: My nasty PITA Bermuda grass is gone in 5 months and 4 sprayings
customer_reviews.text: This stuff will kill your Bermuda grass and it left my tall fescue grass alone. It took about 5 months and 4 sprayings and no bermuda grass to deal with this spring. Your time may be shorter because I started when it was hot in July, they say to spray it in cooler months but I wanted the BG gone. We get up to 110F here in SoCal so it worked here. Yes I would recommend this product to anyone, it's the only one I found to nuke Bermuda Grass.
customer_reviews.author: J. James

customer_reviews.title: I haven’t used it yet
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t used it yet, I’m sure it’s a good product. Will update when I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey K.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on my lawn - did not kill the Kurapia ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on my lawn - did not kill the Kurapia (my new groundover), but was able to take out the quack grass, was slower - which was fine by me.
customer_reviews.author: JWC

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t kill my flowers
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use kills all the grass in my flower beds with out hurting the flowers
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellet product that works, but manage your expecations and follow directions to a T
customer_reviews.text: this stuff works BUT dont expect it to kill bermuda. It will only inhibit its growth. This along with a fescue (or other) seeding regimen will crowd out the bermuda. The only way i know to truly eradicate the bermuda is a total kill and removal and then fresh re-seed.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: kills bermudagrass
customer_reviews.text: bermudagrass in fescue. by 2nd application , it's almost all gone. might do a 3rd pass on it to be safe. nothing else that I tried worked at all.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Jones

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t thoroughly kill bermuda
customer_reviews.text: Did not kill all of my Bermuda that had grown into my liriope and juniper beds. Only partially killed some.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff to get rid of bermuda grass.
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well on my bermuda grass and maybe a little too well on some other nuisance grass I haven't identified. Left a lot of brown patches. I sprayed a little late in the spring, which probably contributed to that problem.
customer_reviews.author: effnut

customer_reviews.title: This works fine but it's not a real fast worker
customer_reviews.text: This works fine but it's not a real fast worker, nevertheless, the grass is now brown. So will use it in other areas of my flower gardens.
customer_reviews.author: MJB

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff when used properly
customer_reviews.text: Works well when used as directed. Will take multiple applications for some grasses. Be patient and don't over apply. Plenty of website articles out there. Read them before using this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Actually works!!!!
customer_reviews.text: THE ONLY THING THAT REALLY WORKS AND IVE TRIED EVERYTHING. Used in a Phoenix Az yard that had bermuda since coverted to all gravel. Had bermuda sticking thru every now and then. This kills it dead and leaves your other flowers in peace.
customer_reviews.author: ZFlyingdancer

customer_reviews.title: Controls Bermuda grass.
customer_reviews.text: Does a very good job of controlling Bermuda grass in my Kentucky Blue grass. Best that I have used.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Kills some crab grass, but still the burmuda grass is HARD to contend with..... somebody help!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tecneek

customer_reviews.title: Good product at decent price
customer_reviews.text: This was just what my husband wanted and a better price than our local home improvement stores.
customer_reviews.author: Kapaxmom

customer_reviews.title: ... with black tape on the cap and it looked like there seal was glued on but all the product ...
customer_reviews.text: The only thing the product came with black tape on the cap and it looked like there seal was glued on but all the product measured out to be 32oz just like the packaged stated. I'm pleased with the product looks like its killing the weeds. Would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: ampen stylus

customer_reviews.title: It really works!
customer_reviews.text: This really works well. Save so much work weeding among lillies, iris, etc. It takes awhile to show the effects but worth the wait.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Harris

customer_reviews.title: Read and understand the directions!
customer_reviews.text: Well it definitely killed my Bermuda grass! Along with everything else! I think I will stick with anything that is green for now on.
customer_reviews.author: William M.

customer_reviews.title: The jury is still out...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to kill the Bermuda grass invading my lawn. It seems to have at least stunned it, but it's kicking the crap outa' my crabgrass. I think it's a bit overpriced for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: One Frogs

customer_reviews.title: It does the work for you
customer_reviews.text: Hooked it up to a handheld dispenser and it was easy to spray in the places I wanted it to go.
customer_reviews.author: Gee

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Takes a while but actually does kill a lot of the nuisance grasses without killing wildflowers
customer_reviews.author: Sue H

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Good product and eliminated the single Bermuda stem I had in the lawn. Be sure to follow the directions closely. I used the product several months ago and no signs of the stubborn Bermuda grass returning.
customer_reviews.author: Ferrari Driver

customer_reviews.title: 1st application had mixed results.
customer_reviews.text: Product work as advertised in some areas and didn't in others. You must apply multiple times a year.
customer_reviews.author: JD E.

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Would have been 5 stars but took 2 weeks to deliver.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Kills bermuda grass without killing grass.
customer_reviews.text: worked great on killing bermuda grass in my lawn without killing the fescue and bluegrass. I used a slightly lower solution-9 oz./gal. with surfactant.I am reordering for a follow up treatment.
customer_reviews.author: Craig/Kay

customer_reviews.title: Product shipped very quickly and customer service was great.
customer_reviews.text: It has taken a few applications to kill bermuda, but it does work. Product shipped very quickly and customer service was great.
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: Eliminated Bermuda in fescue lawn
customer_reviews.text: So far this has completely eliminated the Bermuda in my fescue lawn. Infestation was so bad that I couldn't really tell if it saved any fescue. I'll give it until summer to see how strong this stuff really is.
customer_reviews.author: AEinNC

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great killed the grasses in the wild flower bed, didn't kill any flowers.
customer_reviews.author: G. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works just right and has been safe to other plants.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We have had an invasion of Bermuda. This does ...
customer_reviews.text: We have had an invasion of Bermuda. This does kill it. Just starting using it so not sure about long term effects on roots.
customer_reviews.author: James Cochran

customer_reviews.title: Grass Killer for flower beds
customer_reviews.text: Very slow acting on the grass but does reduce the grass in my Vinca.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Works well to help get rid of unwanted Bermuda grass. Apply before the summer heat. May need more than 1 application. I applied in the Spring. Needed another application, but ran out of time. Fertilized the mostly bare lawn and the fescue grass is making a comeback!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Takes more than one treatment a couple of weeks apart, but so far, has had a positive response
customer_reviews.author: bruce jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use and gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product for the unwanted Bermuda grass in our yard. Very easy to use and it killed the Bermuda grass
customer_reviews.author: Susan Sherman

customer_reviews.title: I have never seen anything like it!
customer_reviews.text: I had used this product before, spraying Bermuda grass in my Iris beds and among my Mondo grass. It works. It kills the Bermuda grass and does not bother the Irises or the Mondo grass.
customer_reviews.author: buy1937

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Got rid of our burmuda grass., when other products couldnt. Tip- wait until burmuda grass is not dormit before applying
customer_reviews.author: Jcbarney

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: This really works well, Killed the grass but did not harm the plants the grass was growing around

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great weed killer among flowers. Would recommend to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: John - St. Charles Il

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Stubborn bermuda grass this year... This year's treatments were not as effective as in prior years :(
customer_reviews.author: Big Barn

customer_reviews.title: Kills the grasses, not the flowers.
customer_reviews.text: I used this product in flower gardens to kill the Bermuda grass that was growing in there but not kill the flowers. I am very satisfied with this product and will buy more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Arnie S.

customer_reviews.title: Hasn't worked... but hasn't been correct wether ...
customer_reviews.text: Hasn't worked...but hasn't been correct wether to apply much either.

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t harm fescue
customer_reviews.text: Worked better than any other product I’ve used for killing Bermuda grass in fescue

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product. No wire grass in my yard. Fast shipping. Highly recommend.

customer_reviews.title: Worked as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This stuff worked! The grass stayed kind of green but it stopped growing and was definitely not happy. I’ll dig it out next week.

customer_reviews.title: ... used this over the years and it is a fantastic product that does what it says it does
customer_reviews.text: I have used this over the years and it is a fantastic product that does what it says it does.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good for suppressing grass while leaving ornamental plants and seed bearers to grow.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Product has worked great, takes a while for it to act. Has killed Bermuda grass growing in shrubs and monkey grass. Have recommended it to several friends.

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: It works for me. You do have to keep at it. You can't spray just once.
customer_reviews.author: Di

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I sprayed this on my lawn which is infested with Bermuda grass. Seems to be working. I’m probably going to give it a second spray.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great solution to a perpetual problem
customer_reviews.text: I've applied two applications of this product on the wild Bermuda in my lawn and it seems to be working very well. I'm going to apply one more time and it should knock it out. Great solution to a perpetual problem!
customer_reviews.author: Julie Junge

customer_reviews.title: Works fast
customer_reviews.text: This stuff started killing the Bermuda grass within a few days...

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on nut sedge. Wish I had found it years ago.

customer_reviews.title: spring cleanup in driveway
customer_reviews.text: love this product. yearly use virtually eliminates grass in gardens and driveways. that's a big plus for me. i will purchase again

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Worked to killed Bermuda grass mixed in with my y’all fescue

customer_reviews.title: Been spraying area's of Bermuda works great. Now going to spray the whole yard
customer_reviews.text: I finally found the only killer of Bermuda grass. Been spraying area's of Bermuda works great. Now going to spray the whole yard. Great stuff and worth the money.

customer_reviews.title: Slowly gone
customer_reviews.text: This product is doing its job just as advertised. Have bought some more for this reason.

customer_reviews.text: Husband needed this for work. Best price was OF COURSE on AMAZON!

customer_reviews.text: It does what it claims to do. Able to control bermuda grass invasion into our flower and vegetable gardens.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff just wish it could be bought in larger quantity
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Yardbird

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great for controlling grass in a perennial or wildflower garden.
customer_reviews.author: J Harmon

product_meta.title: Gordon's Ornamec 170 Grass Herbicide, 32 Ounces
product_meta.description: Ornamec 170 is a selective post emergence herbicide for the control of annual and perennial grasses. Spray ornamentals Over-the-Top. Used as directed, Ornamec 170 grass herbicide will eliminate unsightly, protruding grasses from your existing flower bed project without injuring transplants, emerging flower seedlings or established plants in full bloom. Apply to actively growing grass weeds before they exceed the recommended growth stages on the label. Ready to use-no surfactant required. Tremendous labor-saver. Eliminates hand weeding.
feature_bullets: Ornamec 170 designed for maintenance of landscape beds
Reduces risk of ornamental plant injury
Selectively controls emerged annual grasses - panicums, goosegrass, crabgrass, foxtails and sandbur
Also controls stubborn perennial species like Bermuda grass, quack grass, torpedo grass and Johnson grass
Grass growth stops within 48 hours and death occurs within 1 to 3 weeks
